item.title: A Little Post
item.description: Here's a cute little post Just playing around with code Reticulate lets R and Python interact Python import seaborn as sns df= sns.load_dataset('diamonds') R library(ggplot2) qplot(py$df$price,py$df$carat) Now here's some links Link to project 1 Link to google Now a GIF

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Gabriela Garica GG27447 Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Instructions A knitted R Markdown document (ideally HTML) and the raw R Markdown file (as .Rmd) should both be submitted to Canvas by 11:59pm on 10/11/2020. These two documents will be graded jointly, so they must be consistent (i.e., don’t change the R Markdown file without also updating the knitted document).

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Gabriela Garcia GG27447 Modeling Instructions A knitted R Markdown document (preferably HTML) and the raw R Markdown file (as .Rmd) should both be submitted to Canvas by 11:59pm on the due date. These two documents will be graded jointly, so they must be consistent (i.e., don’t change the R Markdown file without also updating the knitted document). Knit an html copy too, for later! In the .Rmd file for Project 2, you can copy the first code-chunk into your project .

item.title: Projects
item.description: Check out some of my coding projects below: Wrangling & Exploratory Data Analysis Modeling, Inference, Prediction --
